poem:
**Big Blue**

Newsprint smudges my fingers:  
Gerstner—outsider—  
walked into a failing giant  
and would not cut it into babies.

He kept the body whole,  
metal ribs, humming rooms,  
because the customer  
wanted one breath  
not pieces.

Now he is gone—  
and the machines  
go on  
integrating the day.
